title: Fix: Missing fields in recent devlog entries (notes, contexts, etc.)
description: Recent devlog entries are missing important fields like notes, contexts, and other data fields. This may be related to recent MCP changes or storage/serialization issues. Need to investigate data persistence, field mapping, and potential breaking changes in the MCP layer.
technicalContext: Issue affects data integrity and persistence in the devlog system. Recent MCP changes (#220, #218, #219) modified workspace handling and API endpoints. Need to verify if field mapping or serialization was affected.
acceptanceCriteria: All expected fields (notes, contexts, business context, technical context, etc.) are properly saved and retrieved
No data loss in existing entries
New entries include all expected fields

notes.content:
**ROOT CAUSE IDENTIFIED**: The issue is in WorkspaceDevlogManager.createDevlog method at line 267. It's NOT using the proper DevlogManager.createDevlog method that handles field mapping. Instead, it's doing a simplified direct save with `{id, ...data, createdAt, updatedAt}` which doesn't transform businessContext/technicalContext into the context object structure.

The DevlogManager.createDevlog method correctly maps:
- businessContext → context.businessContext  
- technicalContext → context.technicalContext
- acceptanceCriteria → context.acceptanceCriteria
- initialInsights → aiContext.keyInsights

But WorkspaceDevlogManager bypasses this logic and just spreads raw data directly.

  - businessContext → context.businessContext ✓

The fix ensures new devlog entries will have all fields properly mapped and preserved.
